headline: Velo3D Participates in U.S. Army AvMC and M&S Program Funded Initiative to Advance High-Throughput Aluminum CP1 Additive Manufacturing for Defense Applications in Collaboration with RTX and Raytheon Technologies Research Center
summary: Velo3D, Inc. (Nasdaq: VELO), a leader in additive manufacturing (AM) technology known for transforming aerospace and defense supply chains through world-class metal AM, today announced its participation in a U.S. Army Combat Capabilities Development Command Aviation & Missile Center (DEVCOM AvMC) and Manufacturing & Sustainment (M&S) program funded initiative. The effort is focused on advancing high-throughput, cost-effective additive manufacturing processes for Aluminum CP1 to support defense a

headline: Drone Detection Company Evaluation Report 2025 | Lockheed Martin, RTX, and Northrop Grumman Lead with Advanced Defense Technologies and Strategic Contracts
summary: The Drone Detection Companies Quadrant offers an in-depth industry analysis, highlighting key players and trends shaping the global drone detection market. With over 100 companies evaluated, the top 15 were recognized as quadrant leaders, including industry giants like Lockheed Martin, RTX, and Northrop Grumman. The market's growth is fueled by the rising use of drones across sectors and increased demand for airspace security amid geopolitical tensions. Technological advancements, such as AI-pow

headline: Should You Rethink RTX Stock After Its 34% Rally and Record Defense Orders?
summary: Thinking about what to do with RTX stock? You are not alone. After a headline-grabbing rally of 34.3% over the past year, RTX has caught the eye of growth seekers and value hunters alike. If you zoom out even further, the gains are even more impressive, with the stock up 81.8% over three years and a remarkable 188.2% over five years. Those are the kinds of numbers that get investors talking, wondering whether the run will continue or if things are getting overheated. Looking at the broader...
